Bombardier Recreational Products

Multi Body Dynamics Intern – Predictive Engineering

Overview

During my internship at Bombardier Recreational Products, I worked within the Predictive Engineering team, contributing to simulation-driven development and vehicle testing across multiple recreational platforms.

My focus was on multibody dynamics, data analysis, and validation of simulation models using physical test data.

Snowmobile Data Analysis & Duty Cycle Optimization

Project Summary: Processed and analyzed large volumes of snowmobile test data to develop representative duty cycles and create accelerated cycles while retaining original usage patterns.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Processed raw vehicle test data using nCode to clean, organize, and standardize datasets.
  • Developed representative duty cycles and optimized them using Altair HyperStudy.
  • Coordinated data analysis with the predictive engineering team to validate simulation models.

Suspension Modeling & Bump Steer Optimization

Project Summary: Refined multibody suspension models for a three-wheeled vehicle platform to optimize bump steer characteristics.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Edited and updated Altair MotionView suspension models.
  • Performed bump steer optimization using HyperStudy.
  • Communicated findings to the team to inform design adjustments.

Vehicle Testing & Instrumentation Support

Project Summary: Assisted on-site testing of four-wheeler vehicles, focusing on instrumentation and data validation.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assisted with instrumentation setup.
  • Collected and ensure valid test data.
  • Supported engineers in ensuring proper operation of test vehicles.

Vibration & Frequency Analysis for Accessories

Project Summary: Analyzed vibration and frequency behavior of snowmobile accessories to support engineering specifications.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Processed test and simulation data to identify critical frequency ranges.
  • Used nCode for data analysis and plotting.
  • Communicated findings to design engineers for accessory validation.

Tools Used

  • Altair MotionView
  • Altair HyperStudy
  • nCode
  • Excel
  • CATIA

Engineering Skills Developed

  • Multibody dynamics modeling & simulation
  • Vehicle data analysis & duty cycle optimization
  • Suspension kinematics and bump steer evaluation
  • Test planning, instrumentation, and validation
  • Data visualization and technical reporting
